intro: Lucuma excelsa, commonly known as the golden apple, is a species of tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is valued for its edible, sweet, and aromatic fruit. The fruit has a unique, creamy texture and a flavor reminiscent of a mix between a banana and a maple syrup. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. The plant is also noted for its ornamental value due to its showy flowers and evergreen foliage.
